4.1.1 After `GI, `Ap, or a `prAtipadika, ...

4.1.2 `su~, `au, `jas, `am, `auT, `zas, `TA, `bhyAm, `bhis, `Ge, `bhyAm, `bhyas,
`Gasi~, `bhyAm, `bhyas, `Gas, `os, `Am, `Gi, `os, and `sup.

4.1.3 In the feminine, ...

4.1.4 `TAp after ajA-Adi or stems ending with `a;

4.1.5 `GIp after stems ending in `R or `n;
> kartrI

4.1.6 `GIp after stems that are `udit, `Rdit, or `Ldit;
> bhavatI
> pacantI

4.1.7 `GIp after `van, whose final sound is replaced with `r;
> dhIvarI
> zarvarI

4.1.8 `GIp optionally after compound-final `pAd;
> tripAdI

4.1.9 but `TAp after `pAd in the sense of `rc (hymn);

4.1.10 no feminine affix is used after `Sat or `svasR-Adi,

4.1.11 or terms ending in the sounds `man,

4.1.12 or `an at the end of a `bahuvrIhi.

4.1.13 But `DAp optionally occurs after `man and the `an of a `bahuvrIhi.

4.1.14 Excluding `upasarjana stems, ...

4.1.15 `GIp after `Tit, `Dha, `aN, `aJ, `dvayasac, `daghnac, `mAtrac, `tayap, `Thak, `ThaJ, `kaJ, and `kvarap;
> jAnudvayasI "river with knee-deep water"
> jAnudaghnI "id."
> jAnumAtrI "id."
> paJcatayI "having five parts"
> nazvarI "liable to perish, fragile"

4.1.16 `GIp after `yaJ;
> gArgI "descendant of Garga"

4.1.17 `Spha as a `taddhita after `yaJ, according to the Eastern grammarians;
> gArgyAyaNI "granddaughter of Garga"
> gArgI "id."

4.1.18 but `Spha as a `taddhita after the `lohita-`kata list, according to all;
> lauhityAyanI "granddaughter of Lohita"
> zAkalyAyanI "granddaughter of Shakala"

4.1.19 likewise after `kauravya and `mANDUka;
> kauravyAyaNI "granddaughter of Kuru"
> mANDUkAyanI "granddaughter of Manduka"

4.1.20 `NIp after a term denoting the first stage of life.
> kumArI "adolescent female"
> kizorI "id."

4.1.21

4.1.22
